items.content:
Cotiviti Labs Golang Innovator

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Industry: Healthcare, Retail Analytics
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Cotiviti | Atlanta, GA

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 10 hours
Office Location: Atlanta, GA. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

aws-lambda
amazon-web-services
scala
go
python-3.x

Job description

Developers with the Cotiviti Labs team are responsible for working with a global team of medical doctors and business experts to create break-through solutions for incredibly difficult problems. We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies for game-changing solutions. In 2017, we found $3.2B in savings for our clients in 2017 to spend on better health care for their members. 

We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies to put game-changing solutions into production as quickly as possible. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time.  We are a functional programming shop but are willing to use the best technologies to get into production quickly.  Our DevOps team members have created a sophisticated ChatOps infrastructure that supports everything from deployments, to releases, to provisioning new clients. Our continuous integration and build facilities are world class.

Take our online coding test to get the process started!

Apply now

About Cotiviti

The Cotiviti Labs team is the advanced research and development arm of Cotiviti Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: COTV), a leading provider of analytics-driven payment accuracy solutions primarily focused on the healthcare industry. We work with data from billions of health care interactions that occur every day between doctors and patients and convert that data into a rich web of relationships that we then mine for patterns. Each pattern is translated into a solution that helps our clients achieve a superior level of payment accuracy. Joining our team will provide you with a rewarding opportunity to influence healthcare efficiency and effectiveness by discovering and deploying new Cotiviti solutions.

The Cotiviti Labs team has a flat organizational structure so people on this team have no direct managers, are responsible for their own work assignments, and will receive and give quarterly 360 reviews from their peers. We have no deadlines, only a requirement to move as fast as humanly possible and make every minute count. To thrive in this environment team member must have a passion for computer science, technology, innovation, and delivery.

We value teamwork above everything. We succeed together as a team and are accountable to each other for that success. Though we are scattered across the world we regularly get together to have fun. If you are looking for such a tribe apply now.

Learn more about our team by reading our handbook!

Benefits

  • Close to the Marta!
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Remote work available
  • Have a big impact on healthcare
  • Work with an amazing team
  • Use powerful technologies
  • Tuition Reimbersement
  • Flexible work schedule

Job description

Senior Platform Application Engineer

The Senior Platform Application Engineer is responsible for design, development, and implementation of platform components, features and services used by both company and client organizations. You will work Microsoft software development tools, as well as a variety of internal and external applications and resources to enhance the current platform.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Design & implement C# and XAML-based platform components
  • Implement tooling support for rapid application development in the Kahua kBuilder
  • Analyzing, designing, developing and documenting integration applications and services
  • Data integration and workflow design
  • Client implementation support

Desired Skills & Experience

 Technical Skills (required)

  • Sr. C# Developer (5+ years) with Integration Experience
  • MSSQL
  • Microsoft Web API
  • XAML (UWP, WPF, Xamarin)
  • XML, JSON

Business Experience

  • B2B Application Development
  • Working with a Team of Skilled Developers
  • Experience with Multiple Departments
  • Agile / Scrum
Apply now

About Kahua, Inc.

Kahua is reinventing project management and collaboration solutions for real estate, design, engineering, construction and operations. Founded by construction software veterans, Kahua has over 1,000 customers ranging from the largest owners and general contractors to small specialty trade subcontractors. Delivered as a secure, scalable Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS), Kahua enables users to easily share common data, documents and workflows across all applications and projects, and among all authorized business partners. Kahua supports all leading mobile devices and tablets, integrates with third party applications and numerous accounting systems, and enables customers and certified development partners to quickly modify existing applications or build custom applications that operate on the Kahua Platform.

Benefits

  • 20 days of variable PTO
  • An additional week of PTO between December 24th and January 1st
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Coverage
  • 401k – provided through Principal Financial Group
  • Life Insurance coverage - Company paid 2x annual salary
  • Long-term, Short-term Disability

PHP Developer for Large Public Website

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Government, Retail
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Portland Webworks, Inc. | Portland, ME

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time
Office Location: Portland, ME. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

drupal-8
drupal-7
php

Job description

We are seeking PHP developers with strong skills in HTML, CSS, and Javascript. You write elegant, styling code, viewable on a wide range of devices and platforms. You understand Object-Oriented Programming, applying the technique to build maintainable software.  Working with a talented team of developers you can learn from and share your knowledge with is important to you. We want people with your skills and positive attitude to join us.

We have a number of large projects in flight and in our project pipeline. A sampling of some are:

  • Using GIS information to create layers on maps of State camping sites
  • Total Drupal 8 site re-write for a State's Department of Transporation
  • Building Community Sites to bring citizens together with public services

As a developer here at PWW, you can expect to:

  • work on a variety of projects ranging in both size and scope
  • deliver high-quality solutions across multiple industries
  • write blogs and have the opportunity to do technology presentations
  • consult with clients on design
  • work in a dynamic, collaborative environment
  • practice and mentor Agile and Continuous Development practices
  • participate in peer Code Reviews
  • contribute to the company's best practices knowledge base
  • Take part in weekly developer lunches to share new ideas and effect the change you want across a whole team

Types of problems we solve

  •  Search large datasets and display in a human-friendly manner
  •  eCommerce - catalog browsing and ordering.
  •  Large content site creation - theming, custom application integration
  • Interface with external services like Salesforce and national job listing sites

Skills you bring

  • Mastery of front-end development
    • CSS
    • Javascript
    • HTML 5
    • Responsive design
    • Accessibility (508 compliance)
    • Create HTML layout based on UX wireframes and designs
  • PHP
    • Object-Oriented structure development

Bonus Skills you bring are:

  • Experience with building Content Management Systems with Drupal or Wordpress
  • Experience developing applications using Laraval

Tools Used at PWW
We believe in using the best tools to get the job done. At PWW we believe in automating as much as possible and getting new team members quickly up to speed. To achieve this, we use

  • Drupal
  • git
  • drush
  • docker
  • Amazon Web Services
  • PHP Webstorm / IntelliJ / SublimeText / Atom
  • Apache Solr
  • MySql
  • inVision
  • Sketch
  • ....and much more

We offer great benefits to full-time or our on-site team members:

  • Friday Happy Hour
  • Weekly catered developer luncheons
  • Full-time employees earn on average annual profit share of 16% of your base salary 
  • Excellent location in Portland's Old Port neighborhood
  • In-house weekly yoga instruction
  • Flex scheduling
Apply now

About Portland Webworks, Inc.

We are a professional consulting company, building custom solutions for a diverse client base. Healthcare, non-profit, eCommerce, retail, and government agencies, are some of the industries we work with. This diversification creates an exciting work experience by presenting software challenges in a variety of business domains and technical environments. The client and tech mix at PWW are ideal for gaining valuable experience and growing your career.

PWW offers generous insurance plans, annual profit sharing (16% on average), and a fun, engaging work environment.

Benefits

  • 3+ weeks vacation
  • Happy Hour Fridays
  • Yoga
  • Flex Time
  • Casual Environment
  • Excellent downtown Portland Location
  • Excellent Medical Package
  • Company Profit Share
  • Educational Assistance Program
  • Weekly Developer Luncheons

items.title: PRODUCT MANAGER at Mediavine
items.content:
PRODUCT MANAGER

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Advertising, Advertising Technology, Publishing
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Mediavine | No office location

project-management

Job description

We are looking for someone to take over the current product development process and evolve it based upon their own experiences and past successes. Our ideal candidate will be able to juggle multiple products and define priorities for features and issues based on organizational goals and department needs. They will need to understand the big picture but also help us plan out engineering sprints and flush out the detail needed for individual stories.

As a Product Manager at Mediavine, you can expect to:

  • Take ownership for all product roadmaps, both internal and external, and oversee development for those products
  • Create a feasible plan that achieves the goals and objectives of the product and aligns with the organization’s overall business strategy.
  • Be in constant communication with stakeholders, reporting on progress
  • Be responsible for the direction, coordination, implementation, executive, control and completion of project, while remaining aligned with strategy, commitments and goals of the organization.

Requirements:

  • 4+ years experience in a product management role
  • Located within the United States
  • Ability to empathize with customers and anticipate their needs
  • Superb organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal abilities with the ability to stay focused on goals while making sure everyone's voice is heard


Bonus points for:

  • Experience working with Agile Frameworks like SCRUM
  • An “eye” for User Experience/Design
  • Background in software engineering and/or experience with software architecture
  • Previous remote workplace experience

Sr. Route Optimization Engineer

Job description

### DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior route optimization Engineer to join our global team. This role has implementation and troubleshooting responsibilities including handling constraints that change on the fly, utilize self-learning tools based on past data, and sharing results in clean interfaces.

### REQUIREMENTS

* You love doing puzzles
* You have serious math skills
* You've optimized your keyboard shortcuts
* You've written and presented in front of a room that resulted in clapping
* You are able to travel inside both inside the US and out for client meetings

Apply now

About Clevertech

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

items.content:
Senior Threat Researcher

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Computer Software, Cybersecurity, Information Technology
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Carbon Black | No office location

Technologies

c++
security
windows

Job description

Why Carbon Black?

At Carbon Black, you’ll have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats.

If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for four consecutive years. Join us!.

Why You Matter

Carbon Black, the leader in advanced threat protection, is seeking a Senior Threat Engineer. This is a senior level position targeted toward individuals with more than 10 years of experience in software development.  

Experience in software development, debugging, and testing - including in languages such as C++, C, python, assembly, and shell scripting is required.  Understanding of modern defensive and offensive security tools, techniques and methods is also required. Educational and personal experience with network/systems administration and/or information security related work is necessary.

Senior Threat Engineers at Carbon Black are responsible for leading, conducting and presenting threat research done by the Threat Analysis Unit (TAU) and building systems used across our security program.  This includes the strong understanding of endpoint detection, cloud technologies, security operations, current threatscape and emerging threats. Senior Threat Engineers will participate in the design, development, and deployment of tools to assist in threat research and security frameworks utilized by our products.  Senior Threat Engineers are also expected to provide mentorship to other members of the team, and take lead in maturing procedures, evaluating new security technologies, incident response, penetration testing, and prototype/experiment with new ideas and technologies to improve both our product and services.

What You’ll Do

  • Actively work on current software development projects related to product enhancements and efficacy.  Create new software tools for internal research and development.
  • Design and implement software proof of concepts for emerging malware technique detections.
  • Performs security research, reverse engineer malware, handle complex security events, and analyze incident response, and coordinating with other teams.
  • Work closely with internal and external customers for product and service improvements.
  • Take ownership or support ongoing projects by assisting in the implementation, research, testing and documentation of security related projects.
  • Maintain knowledge of emerging security technologies and discipline developments. Research and manage the implementation of new technologies to enhance our products and customers’ security postures.
  • Actively participate in the Carbon Black User-Exchange community as a subject matter expert, presenting in forums, online and at conferences.

Technical Skills / Experience:

  • Experience with a number of the following is a requirement: C, C++, x86/x64 assembly, Python, Unix Shell scripts, Powershell
  • Experience in participating in medium and large scale software development projects - from initial conception and design to final deployment.
  • Experience with Java or C# is a plus
  • Windows operating system internals (registry, APIs, kernel operations, forensic artifacts)
  • Windows development of user mode applications using Visual Studio.  Kernel development experience is a plus. Development on other platforms other than Windows is also a plus.
  • Ability to translate descriptions of attacks or malware techniques into proof of concept demonstrations for testing and product improvement.

What You’ll Bring

  • Windows or other operating system internals experience
  • Knowledge of x86 and x64 instruction set architectures
  • Knowledge of user and kernel level debuggers and static analysis applications such as WinDbg, OllyDbg, x64dbg, Binary Ninja, or IDA Pro
  • Ability to analyze malware, determine TTPs (tactics, techniques, and procedures) unique to threat actors, and extract indicators to feed back into the products
  • Strong interpersonal skills, ability to mentor/train staff and bring awareness to current and emerging threats
  • Certifications preferred: CISSP, OSCP/OSCE, SANS GIAC Certifications (GREM, GCFA, GCFE)
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills with an ability to present technical risks and issues to non-technical audiences
Apply now

About Carbon Black

Who We Are
Carbon Black is a leading provider of next-generation endpoint security. Carbon Black serves more than 3,700 customers globally, including 33 of the Fortune 100. As a cybersecurity innovator, Carbon Black has pioneered multiple endpoint security categories, including application control, endpoint detection and response (EDR), and next-generation antivirus (NGAV). Leveraging its big data and analytics cloud platform – the Cb Predictive Security Cloud – Carbon Black solutions enable customers to defend against the most advanced cyber threats, including malware, ransomware, and non-malware attacks. Deployed via the cloud, on premise, or as a managed service, customers use Carbon Black solutions to lock down critical systems, hunt threats, and replace legacy antivirus.

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company.

Benefits

  • Flexible vacation
  • Remote/Work-from-home options
  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • Stand-up desks and unique workspaces
  • Free snacks/drinks, Happy Hours, and regular catering
  • Care.com access and pet insurance
  • On-site gym
  • Career development programs
  • Lounge/game room
  • Competitive salaries, 401k, and stock options

items.content:
Digital Marketing Director at Adventure Project

Remote

TELECOMMUTE Brooklyn, New York, United States

DESCRIPTION

The Director of Marketing will work closely with and report to our Co-Founder and CEO. In this role you will have the chance to help build The Adventure Project’s online profile and position ourselves as a leader in the nonprofit space.

This is an exciting opportunity to inspire an engaged, educated, and passionate audience. This pivotal role will lead the Adventure Project’s online fundraising and engagement efforts. In addition, you’ll have the opportunity to lead our marketing and online fundraising strategies, as well as developing and finalizing our branding and voice.

Responsibilities:

  • Creating annual and long-term goals and projections for lead generation, member recruitment and engagement, and fundraising targets and goals.
  • Implementing creative advertising, social media, email, and print campaigns.
  • Identify new acquisition channels for acquiring supporters, with a focus on growing and cultivating our monthly members.
  • Building and leading a rockstar communications and marketing team.
  • Establishing team and individual goals, set and manage marketing budgets, and monitor team performance. Share regular feedback with the team and conduct annual performance reviews, including salary adjustments and promotions.
  • Hiring and managing consultants and/or agencies to execute campaigns in a cost-effective and sustainable way.
  • Managing and reporting on the effectiveness of our giving channels, tweaking inputs and making recommendations.

In the first quarter, we expect you to:

  • Audit our assets and identify opportunities to expand our funnels on our website, email and social channels
  • Work with designer and team to overhaul and streamline our website UX.
  • Work with consultants on strengthening our SEO and AdWords, reviewing and testing new ideas.
  • Establish firm branding and messaging for the organization that can be shared internally and externally.
  • Develop our annual marketing strategy, with benchmarks and goals for each of our giving channels.
  • Launch a campaign with a focus on building our Collective Members (monthly giving).

Responsibilities:

  • Manage all digital marketing channels (e.g. website, blogs, emails and social media) to ensure brand consistency.
  • Develop specific campaigns to create and maintain high levels of customer interaction.
  • Oversee our social media accounts.
  • Manage and improve online content, considering SEO and Google Analytics.
  • Forecast giving performance trends and act proactively to increase our market segment.

Goals / Success Metrics:

  • Growing our monthly giving community to thousands of active and engaged members
  • Drastically increase relevant website traffic and successfully convert visitors to get more involved.

Your Qualities:

You’re Experienced: You thrive at the intersection of big-picture strategy and detail-oriented execution. You have experience growing an online movement and relish the opportunity to take our grassroots movement and give it wings.

You’re Data-Driven: You like to take risks and try new things but also appreciate data and getting the basics right. You love testing and tweaking communications materials to see what works best.

You’re Creative: You enjoy thinking creatively about how to build partnerships, target supporters and create content that engages and inspires people to join our movement.

You Get Things Done: You are entrepreneurial and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment that feels more like a start-up than a traditional non-profit. No task is too big or too small. You follow-through, take initiative and get things done. You also value time and positive ROI; you can identify what should be outsourced, delegated or done in-house.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5 years experience with demonstrated excellence in digital fundraising and engagement.
  • Experience with subscription-based business models, digital commerce and marketing KPIs.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of existing digital strategies and tools including but not limited to SEM/SEO, display advertising, re-targeting, affiliate marketing, email marketing and acquisition, and both organic & paid social media. Google Analytics is a must.
  • Proven ability to develop strategic and fundraising plans that get results through advertising, social media, email and print campaigns.
  • Persuasive and passionate written communicator.
  • Previous experience building and/or managing a team.
  • Proven work experience as a Digital Marketing Director or related position.
  • Demonstrable experience in designing and implementing successful digital marketing campaigns.
  • Strong understanding of how all current digital marketing channels function.
  • Familiarity with web design (design and content development skills are a plus).
  • Excellent analytical and project management skills.
  • Passion, idealism, integrity, positive attitude, mission-driven, and self-directed.

BENEFITS

We create good jobs around the world, so we believe you should have a good job, too. Salary is competitive and commensurate with experience and skills.

Benefits Include:

  • Full health care, dental and vision coverage
  • Transportation stipend (monthly MTA metrocard)
  • Flexible work hours and vacation time
  • Matching 401K
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave

Our HQ:

We sit in two, private sun-filled suites within an incredible shared workspace (WeWork) in DUMBO, Brooklyn. Just one block from the York Street F stop, it’s an easy commute for those in Brooklyn and Manhattan, and within walking distance to some of our favorite restaurants. We’re dog-friendly, kid-friendly and greatly enjoy the free coffee and on-site barista.

Flex-time and Remote Options:

Flex-time and remote work locations are available options, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply. Flex-time could mean working some hours outside the traditional 9-5, or it can be a reduction of hours for an adjusted salary.

Apply for job

items.content:
SEO Specialist for Outreach, Audits, Keyword Research and more

Company: Sagashi Labs
Headquarters: Remote
http://sagashilabs.com/
Note: I'm hiring for several roles to do outreach (backlink building), keyword research, and SEO audits. Please note in your application which of these you can do.

Sagashi Labs is an SEO consultancy where we help clients achieve real business outcomes by increasing their visibility and traffic from search engines. We primarily work with tech enabled business and startups, but we also work with professional service providers in the medical field. Most of our clients are up and coming startups backed by Y-Combinator and have received millions of dollars in funding.

All of our work is white-hat and the key services we offer are:
  • Link building
  • Technical Audits
  • Onpage audits
  • Keyword research
  • Page title and meta description CTR experiments
  • Content strategy
  • SEO training

I'm looking for reliable remote workers who have significant SEO experience either inhouse or agency. Please highlight your agency experience and tenure in your application. You can be moonlighting, just so long as you have no conflicts of interests between your clients and ours.

Primarily I need people who can do keyword research according to my methodology (I can explain this to you) along with thorough SEO audits that are well-formatted, have a high attention to detail and leave no stone unturned.

You'll love SEO. It has to be something you naturally enjoy doing. Also, you take great pride in doing a top notch job, and paying attention to the details you think nobody else will notice. Most importantly, you'll have a committed attitude where you take your work seriously and give your full attention and effort to the task at hand. Your word is your bond and you honour your commitments.

I prefer working with remote workers but it's important that you see this as a true commitment. I'm not looking for someone who is looking to fund a party around the world lifestyle. I'm looking for someone who values their location independence but wants to do good work.

Tasks you should have high levels of competence in:
  • Quickly navigating Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and professional SEO tools (SEMRush, Ahrefs, Moz, etc) to find data, and perform analysis
  • Can create Sitemap.xml, Robots.txt files.
  • Can walk me through your keyword research methodology, and discuss the pros and cons of different approaches. Likewise for technical audits, and onsite audits.
  • Can walk me through how search engines operate, including PageRank, crawl budget, indexation, and so on.

Requirements

  • Have at least 3 years SEO agency experience or 5 years inhouse SEO experience and can discuss results achieved
  • Strong Google sheets skills including using formulas and formatting
  • Web research skills to quickly find webmaster contact details
  • Ability to write persuasive and polite emails
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent written English and communication skills
  • Proactive and focused
  • Good at following instructions
  • Takes pride in doing a good job
  • Punctual and maintains deadlines
  • Mature and positive attitude

What we offer:

  • Competitive hourly rates
  • Independence
  • We can pay weekly
  • Typically working on startup accounts - less bureaucracy, more focus on results.
  • Work directly with the founder who has a track record of success in startups and Silicon Valley as a Head of Growth at Gigster.
  • Starting at 10 - 20 hours a week with a likelihood for more as the business grows and you demonstrate competence. Currently I'm at capacity and turning away clients.

The Application Process

  1. Send in your application to the email provided including your work history, and cover letter. Please let me know your current situation, what you're looking for, what time zone you're typically in, and your general availability. Level of English if you are not a native speaker.
  2. I'll then contact shortlist candidates to perform a test task. Every candidate will receive the same task. It will be capped at 3 hours in time commitment.
  3. Next is a video call interview to discuss your test task, SEO background, and the role.

At FreeBusy we Do Epic Sh*t! We are bringing to the 21st century group scheduling which is a necessity for how we all get stuff done. At FreeBusy we Do Epic Sh*t! We are bringing to the 21st century group scheduling which is a necessity for how we all get stuff done. The way we interact with email has evolved somewhat in the last 20 years, but calendars are stuck in the 90s. The only recent innovation is around making the calendar view prettier and more useful to the owner.

The main reason for which we plan our day is because time is the most important commodity in the world. Calendars today are good for recording our daily agenda, but they are terrible at coordinating time with others. We’re focusing on coordinating daily life because that’s where tons of value can be added. Join us!

What We're Building

Calendar usage grew tremendously in the past few years fueled by adoption of cloud services and mobile devices. Unfortunately, appointments are spread across many services and we are still wasting a lot of time in back-and-forth emails or phone calls. It's often impossible to share real-time availability with others because Outlook and Google Calendar don't work cross-company.

FreeBusy is a scheduling assistant powered by A.I. to coordinate meetings 10x faster with contacts inside and outside your company. You can interact with FreeBusy on the web, smartphone, and desktop, using voice, chat, and email. FreeBusy
works with existing calendars (Google, Office 365, Exchange, iCloud, Outlook.com, etc.) and you can link as many as you have (work, personal, school). Easily share unified availability with business contacts whether they use FreeBusy or not.

Our current focus is to increase enterprise agility when scheduling meetings cross-company. Watch our story https://youtu.be/HobWYI-QYQM

items.content:
Product Manager Growth (m/f)


Komoot

 verified
Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times—and we are consistently ranked amongst the highest-grossing apps in both Google Play and the App Store. To help us to continue to grow the biggest community of outdoor enthusiasts on the planet, we’re looking for an ambitious product manager to join our world-class dev team.

**Your key responsibilities**
* Work hands-on with designers, copywriters and engineers to create convincing and personalized onboarding flows, retention mechanisms and social features.
* Work with SEO and marketing specialists to create funnels that attract and convert highly engaged cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts.
* Run tests, get feedback from users and colleagues, crunch the numbers, and iterate fast on all our platforms, including web, mail, push notifications and apps.
* Be an advocate for both our users and our business, and drive product development that meets award-winning quality standards.

**Why you’ll love it**
* You’ll take over responsibility and ownership of your projects from day one.
* You’ll develop products that will become an integral part of one of the highest-grossing apps—and will be used by millions all over the world.
* We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, our headquarters in Potsdam or anywhere that lies between the time zones UTC-1 and UTC+3.
* You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers.
* You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love.
* You’ll join us for team gatherings in locations like Mallorca or the Bavarian Alps several times a year.

**You will be successful in this position if you**
* Have 3+ years of experience as a product manager for a digital product.
* Have extensive knowledge in optimizing user journeys, conversion funnels and social loops.
* Have proven knowledge of the cycling and outdoor market and their respective customer segments.
* Have an excellent sense of product, design and copy.
* Can turn complex problems into simple experiences, taking care of every little detail.
* Have a structured and methodical way of working and leading complex cross-functional projects.
* Are hungry to learn and challenge yourself.

**Sound like you?**
Send us the following:
* Your CV.
* A little note on why are you interested in working at komoot.
* Work examples: Show us a little about the projects you’ve worked on in the past.
* Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account or your blog.
* You’ll get bonus points for doing something creative with komoot — we love it when people go the extra mile.

Requirements

Please apply with cover letter and resume through our website.

See more jobs at Komoot

  • Want to work with fast-learning teammates on a difficult demand problem?
  • Enjoy challenging and growing your teammates?
  • Feel excited about re-imagining demand strategy for a product already used by over 12K customers?
  • Believe human conversation powers small businesses?

If so, we’d love to hear from you!

You:
  • You’re a proven marketing strategist and leader. You understand growth and demand, have an analytical mindset and enjoy solving problems by using data. You are comfortable driving short and long term growth in demand, brand recognition, and market share.
  • You’ve worked in marketing management, have been a people manager (and loved it), and thrive on growing a team.
  • You’re a collaborator and enjoy working cross-functionally.  
  • You have impeccable communication skills, both written and verbal.

Be prepared to help us understand your level of knowledge of:
  • Inbound marketing
  • Search engine optimization
  • Email Nurture strategies and systems
  • Earned and paid media
  • Channel marketing - affiliates, partners, referral/review websites and app stores

We recognize that a variety of backgrounds could be suitable for this role. We encourage applicants from a diversity of industries and experiences to apply. As part of the application, you will be asked to write out answers to a set of questions that directly tie to the two major requirements of this role: solving demand challenges, and helping to grow and lead our team as a people manager.

This is an excellent position for someone who likes to dig in, tackle challenges, and grow a marketing team. In short, we are looking for a marketing expert who can teach us and lead us.

This role can be based anywhere in the United States or Canada.  We take culture and values seriously at Olark — you can read about our team culture at olark.com/jobs, and our values at olark.com/values. Beyond what you see there, as a member of the marketing team you can expect:

  • A great remote culture and team: Even though we’re separated by physical distance, our team makes the effort to connect and learn from and about one another. We genuinely like each other, and we interact constantly throughout the day.   
  • A life outside of work: Olarkers generally work 40 hour weeks. Work is a marathon, not a sprint. We are building a company for the long haul.
  • Time to do focused work: We keep required meetings to a minimum — currently, we have two weekly marketing meetings, and one weekly company-wide sync. We strive for flexibility and efficiency in communication, so we all have the time we need to focus and think.

Please note that the hiring process will likely take ~8 weeks. As we are a tight-knit and highly collaborative team, there will be interviews with our marketing team, CEO, COO and members of our management team.

Olark is committed to diversity in its workforce. Olark is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status.


Apply for this position

Please apply here: https://olark.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk018ji

items.content:
Digital Marketing Assistant Manager

Company: PearlsOfJoy.com
Headquarters: Los Angeles
http://www.pearlsofjoy.com
I'm looking for an up and coming marketer who wants to work with our suite of fast growing E-commerce companies. 

Your role will be working side by side(remotely) with the CEO. Together with the CEO you will work on innovative marketing strategies.

Want to work with FB chatbots and drive sales...? Cool we do that
Want to see how we produce 40% of our revenue from segmented email marketing...? Ya we do that.
Want to help with PR and see how we got featured on Forbes.com?
Love working with FB ads? We're pretty good there too! 

Platforms we work with:

  • Klaviyo
  • Privy
  • Adwords
  • Facebook Ads
  • Instagram
  • shopify
  • Manychat
  • are more...

This role will start as a part time gig, but ideally the right candidate will grow into our full-time head of marketing.  We're growing fast and want you to grow along with us. 

So if you're an insanely passionate marketer, looking to join a remote team that's growing like crazy - reach out today. 

Ideal Candidate Will:

  • Live and breath digital marketing(PPC, Copywriting, PR, Email, etc.) 
  • Spend time every day learning (podcasts, courses, reading, etc.) 
  • Love getting "in the weeds" with platforms
  • Always looking to improve and find a better faster way to get results
  • Takes success personally & learning from failures and relishing the big wins. 
  • Have basic to intermediate HTML and image editing skills
  • Have a strong opinion and willing to argue their point of view with facts and data. 

Payment & Hours

  • Actual billable hours will vary, likely 10hr+ / week to start
  • Compensation will vary depending on experience ($15 - $25/hr)
  • Position is on a contract basis (you bill hours worked, we pay bi-weekly)

GM India - Product, Sales, Marketing, & Evangelism at Crowdera

India, Mumbai, Nagpur, Remote · Full Time

Probably there are a million ways to build promising career, but nothing beats being part of a compassion driven economy where abundance starts with giving. Crowdera has created world’s first truly free fundraising platform that does not charge any commission or ask for tip from donors. We are changing the way people give and align themselves with the causes and individuals they fund & support. Our continuos evolution will help fundraisers to add sustenance to their organizations, improve their lives, make a lasting impact. What we are set to achieve in next few years will make you fall in love with us. Plus, you get to work with & mentored by silicon valley business leaders and tech gurus with pedigree of eBay, Amazon, Google, Columbia. Ask us and we will give 10 more reasons to work with us.

Applied
Apply to Crowdera
Add a message to Crowdera
Apply

Job Description

As GM India, you will report directly to the founder and will be part of core management team. Your sole purpose is to set-up a strong presence of Crowdera in India by evangelizing, and to progress the vision of the company through action on the ground. You have to a self-starter, build the Indian operations ground up, evangelize & scale Crowdera's brand among all business associates and partners – philanthropists, social entrepreneurs, high net worth donors & investors, corporates, celebrities or government officials.

In this demanding and multidimensional role, you will serve as a trusted aide to the founder on planning and execution of all matters pertaining to Crowdera’s India operations.

Success in this role will be defined by your ability to think both strategically and tactically, exercise good judgment, build and manage excellent relations with clients, lead team and numerous assignments with perfection in a fast-paced and creative environment.

Responsibilities
- Evangelize Crowdera vision and mission within India.
- Spearhead the customer development & customer fundraising success.
- Build partnerships with large corporations, public sector, third sector, foundations, celebrity circuit, and HNIs in APAC.
- Lead sales and corporate development in corporate giving space and fundraising space.
- Keep track of new legislative developments on CSR and trends in Corporate Giving.
- Build & manage India team. Be responsible for all HR functions and beyond– morale, motivation, performance, hiring, retention, termination.

Skills
Business Development, Corporate Development, Product Marketing, Non-Profit Experience, Customer Development, Social Media Marketing, Press Outreach, Social Entrepreneurship, Sales and Marketing, Executive Leadership, Crowdfunding, Social Media Strategy, Corporate Social Responsibility, Corporate and Marketing Strategy, Non-Profit Fundraising, Press and Corporate Communications, Nonprofit Management, Philanthropy, Celebrity/Influencer Outreach, Employee Engagement and CSR activities

Crowdera is a cloud-based fundraising platform and offers a comprehensive fundraising framework for non-profits and social innovators to raise funds without any form of donor dippings. It facilitates all aspects of the online fundraising ecosystem including donation buttons, cross-site donation widgets, websites (CMS), P2P campaigns, donation management, and much more.

Marketing Internship - Young Talent Program at Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org

Dubai, Remote · Internship
Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.Read More

Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.

How?

Our vision is to improve accessibility through modern technology.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help us create the next big thing. Help us shake up the scene using your strengths and bring new ideas to the table.

We are a dynamic young startup based out of Dubai, looking to grow the family. Be a part of this exciting phase and grow something that is growing fast.

About the team: We are result driven, value being practical, our work environment is flexible, and we are all very ambitious. Are you someone who wants to create something amazing, be empowered and are hands on?

Who we are? At Teach Me Now, we are an international mix that have passions for things like rollerblading, argentine tango, intellectual debates and indulging in amazing food at the office.

We are looking for people who dare to be different and want to be a part of something that help change the way the world learns.

Applied
Apply to Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org
Add a message to Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org
Apply

Job Description

To celebrate new ideas and foster innovation we are launching the Young Talent Program. Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.

How? To improve accessibility through modern technology.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help us create the next big thing in education and shake up the scene using your strengths and bring new ideas to the table.  

Our rigorous program provides you with the opportunity of taking the lead and develop skills in the following:

Month 1: Market and Business Development

You will conduct market research; strategies international marketing plans, use in-depth analytical tools and structure your processes.

Month 2: Digital Marketing

This month will focus on social media marketing and lead generation. This is understanding more than just likes and virality but also engagement, content creation, media planning, strategy and SEO optimisation. Creating a strategy and testing what works. Learn fast, fail fast.

Month 3:  Product Development

In Tech, product development, testing and iteration is key. Be a part of the process and help bring the product to life. You will be a part of testing, feedback data analysis, and more.

Opportunity for a Full-time Position:

Upon the completion of the program, successful candidates are up for the possibility of full time hire and being part of the core team and can focus on one of the three categories.

Requirements:
1. University Degree (Completed or Currently Pursuing)
2. Fluent in English (Additional Language is a plus)
3. International experiences or exposure
4. Passion for education and technology

Technical Competencies:

1. Eagerness to make a difference and stimulate change
2. Courage to challenge the status quo and persistence to succeed and achieve challenging tasks.
3. Analytical and love data!

Communication:

The ability to plan and deliver communication in a persuasive and tactful way. You must be fluent in English.

To Apply:

Send your CV and cover letter to hr@teachmenow.com. You need to tell us why you want to work with us.

Early applications are preferred. Full time job offer will be considered after the internship is complete.

Skills
User Experience Design, Social Media Marketing, Market Research, Sales and Marketing, Software

items.content:
Director of Marketing // Tech Open Air Berlin

Company: Tech Open Air Berlin

Tags:
  • management
  • strategy
  • director

    • About TOA

    What started as the world’s first crowdfunded festival seven years ago, turned into a 4-day flagship festival in Berlin and a series of event chapters around the world. We’ve just delivered our 7th festival edition in June 2018 for 21,000 attendees with 100+ Satellite events from across Berlin city, and our Conference covering 6 stages, 24 themes, 10 formats, 100+ Exhibitors at the Haus of Tech, and the long-awaited TOA Night with art and music at its core.

    Our mission is to make you future-proof.

    We are the world’s first crowdfunded conference. Today we are building a global, inclusive platform for knowledge exchange and collaboration.

    We believe that technology is transforming the way we work, live, and relate to others. Next to the challenges this brings, it also catalyzes opportunities for positive change in the world.

    We provide access to the people building impactful technology and who share their expertise with our community for everyone to experience the culture of Generation We.

     

    Your Role

    As our Director of Marketing, you will be responsible for leading the strategy and implementation of TOA’s growth and internationalization via the crucial elements – revenue growth, data & business intelligence, digital marketing & content, community & support as well as brand identity and products.

    What You Get

    Let’s be honest. Protein bars, dog-friendly office, Berlin VIP party lists, cacao ceremonies ain’t gonna cut it here. We all know that being a startup in events is challenging, but we’re offering you to be part of a hypnotic TOA journey. If your wish is to actually make a difference with your work and help shape and build a business, this role is for you.

    Responsibilities

    • Develop marketing strategies in alignment with TOA’s strategy and vision.
    • Lead strategic and operational execution of all marketing activities (data, digital marketing & content, community, brand identity, paid organic search marketing) to support overall TOA’s growth and brand positioning.
    • Recruit and manage TOA’s marketing team making sure they are devoted, mentored, supported and challenged.
    • Create and lead the processes and workflows to spot on opportunities in the market and improve and grow TOA’s brand identity.
    • Own TOA’s marketing budget planning, forecasting and execution.
    • Support other key roles in sales, content, production teams with various levels of experience in best practices in terms of team, strategy, brand identity and product development.

    Who You Are

    • You have a minimum of 10 years experience in marketing and branding strategy, planning and execution roles leading marketing team(s); managing remote team(s) would be a plus.
    • You have experience in entering new markets, positioning a brand and products / services based on channels like digital marketing & content, paid organic search marketing, community building.
    • You have experience in managing the creative tension across key roles in leadership to reach the overall strategy and purpose of the company.
    • You have knowledge, experience and interest in tech and startup ecosystem to quickly react to the latest market, geography and trend shifts.
    • You have complete command of German and English language.
    • You are willing to work on contract basis.
    Apply for this position

Summary

We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving individual based in Europe to join the team working on expansion of the company in global markets. This is a full time placement with significant opportunities for growth, travel and advancement as one of the first employees of the company.

The Company

causaLens is high-tech startup based in London. We are bringing the next level of automation, Automation of Machine Learning and Big Data technologies to the World’s most sophisticated organizations. We are an extraordinary team and the founders have worked for some of the most prominent organizations including hedge funds and research organizations.

Core requirements

● Technical/ engineering background preferred

● Highly capable, self-motivated, collaborative and personable

● Strong academic record

● Strong commercial skills gained from a professional background

● Interest in advanced technologies such as machine learning

● Able to demonstrate integrity, drive and natural curiosity

● An excellent written and verbal communicator with a high level of business acumen

● Ability to effectively work remotely (from home or coworking space)

Roles and Responsibilities:

● The role is varied and involves a combination of strategic & critical thinking, analysis and engagement with internal and external stakeholders.

● You will generate sales leads and communicate with senior executives from the most innovative industries.

● You will be running competitive and market analysis.

● You will identify new business opportunities.

● You will identify trends and new technologies in the Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Fintech market.

● You will work directly with the CEO on developing and evaluating new opportunities.

Benefits

Successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about innovation and making a difference. We will offer guidance, mentorship, and opportunities for professional development.

items.content:
Product Marketing Manager


Gathercontent

 verified
**What’s the opportunity?**

We've been around 6 years and have built a strong reputation amongst the content strategy community. Through relentless customer development we’ve identified an enormous market opportunity for Content Operations (ContentOps).

ContentOps addresses the gap that exists between content strategy and publishing platforms/traditional CMS'. Without dedicated ContentOps there is complete chaos resulting in poor content, costing organisations time, money and reputation.

We help our customers unify their people, process and content. They're now able to quickly produce and publish effective content at scale; with less headaches, less errors and better results.

Our view is that effective content is going to be prioritised in every business and organisation and well executed ContentOps will be a requirement for this to happen. We’re already seeing this in our roster of customers; from Higher Education to Healthcare, Harvard to the NHS.


**What’s the role?**

You’ll be primarily responsible for helping our existing and prospective customers understand, and get excited, by the value our Content Operations Platform offers. You’ll figure out how to open their eyes to new and better ways of working.

Day-to-day you’ll take ownership over product and feature launches, developing and executing GTM strategies for various verticals and product use-cases. You’ll work closely with our customers to develop a deep understanding of their challenges and discover new ways to tell their stories. You’ll support the sales team to ensure they have everything they need to bring new customers on board and expand existing accounts.

You’ll also help champion the development and popularisation of a new category. You’ll have ownership over your numbers and how you hit them. You’ll obsess over how to position us in the minds of our customers and finally, you’ll continuously improve yourself and support your colleagues.

**What we can offer you:**
* Remote working - we offer the opportunity to work remotely. Whether you want to join a co-working space, work from home or travel: the choice and flexibility are yours.
* Family friendly - the company is very family oriented and understands the necessary flexibility.
* Work/life balance - we work a 35 hour week and encourage downtime. It’s about doing a few things well and not burning ourselves out.
* The chance to make an impact on our business - As a small team there is a big opportunity for everyone to contribute, collaborate and make their mark.
* Fun team - Even though we work remotely, the entire team get together in London every 4 months to eat good food and have fun.
* Stock options and pensions

**What we need in return:**
* Your undivided passion, energy, focus and enthusiasm.
* A self-starter attitude with experience managing and prioritising your own workload.
* An ability to get things done efficiently (whilst maintaining quality): working at a consistent pace.
* A team-player who works as well with others as individually.
* Strong opinions, loosely held - no fear when it comes to inputting ideas and participating in discussions with the team. You must be happy to take critique, self-improve and move forward.
* An iterative approach - We focus on learning and improving our processes as we go.
* Customer focus - You should always be thinking, “What can I be doing to deliver value to our customers?”
* Leave your ego at the door. We’ve got a very collaborative, blame-free culture with a shared focus on what’s best for the company.

Requirements

**How to apply**We’d love to see some examples of your work, your blog (if you have one) and a cover letter with answers to the following questions:* Why do you want to work at GatherContent?* Can you share a piece of work that you’re proud of, or that you think represents an important part of your philosophy?* Can you tell us about a hard problem you’ve had to solve, and how you went about solving it?* Can you give us a brief description of your background?Also, please include the word ‘blueberry’ in your cover letter to show that you’ve read the job role (helps us weed out time wasters!). We look forward to seeing your application.**What happens next?**We review all of the applications, screen for experience, attention to detail and general suitability.Applicants who are successful will go through a remote/online values interview with two of our team members. If successful, the next step is a remote/online skills interview. Applicants who make it through these stages meet with our Marketing Director in person (in London or Brighton). Travel and expenses will be covered. Finally, you will be given a paid homework assignment to complete.We will then be in touch to let you know if you are successful.**About us**GatherContent is a Content Operations Platform that helps teams produce effective content at scale.Customers use our platform to manage the people and process, for producing content that meets user and business needs.We work with leading digital agencies, higher education institutions, governments, non-profits, membership organisations and many enterprise customers. Some of our customers include Digitas LBI, Harvard University, The Australian Government and Intel.We launched in 2012 and now help thousands of customers, all over the world. Our team is fully remote, working from all over the UK.

Location: United Kindgom

See more jobs at Gathercontent

items.content:
Product Manager, Acquiring Platform

Company: Stripe
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA

Build products to make customers successful.

The Payments Group at Stripe powers Stripe’s core payments-related products such as payment processing, fraud prevention, and Connect.

About the role:

At Stripe, Product Managers help build innovative payments products for our customers. Product development is an extremely collaborative effort between engineering, design, analytics and customer-facing teams. You’d be joining a team of experienced Product Managers who have a track record of successfully building large-scale business and consumer products that are collectively impacting millions of users around the world.

As the Product Manager on the Acquiring Platform team, you’ll work right at the center of Stripe, enabling and expanding the payment capabilities that are core to the Stripe experience.

  • Define and create the critical infrastructure that will power Stripe’s global payment network
  • Develop deep integrations with card networks and financial partners to create new and innovative capabilities
  • Drive the expansion of Stripe’s capabilities around the world
  • Launch a new products and tools that enable new payment experiences for our merchants

You may be a good fit if:

  • You’re a creative product thinker who loves challenging technical problems and collaborates well with engineering, analytics, marketing, and external partners
  • You have experience building or working on technical platforms that enable concurrent development of features by teams located around the world
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems and infrastructural challenges
  • You have experience working on deeply technical software products from kick-off to ship
  • You do whatever it takes to make your product and team successful whether that means writing a QA plan or hunting down the root cause of a user’s frustration
  • You can turn incomplete, conflicting, or ambiguous inputs into solid action plans
  • Beyond just shipping new products, you obsess about continuous product improvement and can optimize for shipping a portfolio of small, medium and large releases.

Requirements:

  • Experience working in the financial industry where you gained an understanding of financial infrastructure and how financial services differ across the world

What’s it like to work at Stripe?

Stripe is helping the internet fulfill its potential as a platform for economic progress by building software tools that accelerate global economic access and technological development. Stripe makes it easy to start, run and scale an internet business from anywhere in the world.

Stripe is, at its heart, an engineering company. To provide a missing pillar of core internet infrastructure, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills (and from a wide variety of backgrounds) who are ready to take on some of the most challenging problems in the industry – from reliably handling 100M API requests per day, to building adaptive machine learning as a result of years of data science and infrastructure work, and enabling entrepreneurs worldwide to start a global internet business.

We look at Stripe as a constant work in progress and the same is true of our people; for all of us, we believe the best is yet to come. We’re here to support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues.

We encourage all engineers to transition teams once every year and a half and also take on short-term projects with other teams across Stripe. This enables engineers to learn how different parts of Stripe work while also establishing stronger ties and cross-pollination between groups.

We contribute to existing open-source projects and the people working on them, and we release several tools as open-source.

We want to work in a company of warm, inclusive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well. The kind of people who are committed to going out of their way to help other Stripes in the short-term and pushing them to improve over the long-term (by helping them to get better at what they do).

We’re a highly cross-functional organization and view that as part of the fun: we design our space to encourage as much collaboration as possible. We have long tables in the kitchen for a reason (to enable everyone to meet new people and learn from them). We also have a culture of transparency that we carry through to email communication, ensuring that Stripes all around the world have the information they need to make good local decisions.

In both our products and our people, we aim to reflect, represent and advocate for all of our users, globally. Our users transcend geography, culture and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a fairer, more economically interconnected world.

Guide to the onsite interview

items.title: Mitchell Harper Digital: Conversion Rate Optimization / Growth Expert
items.content:
Conversion Rate Optimization / Growth Expert

Company: Mitchell Harper Digital
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
Hey there,

We (Mitchell Harper Digital) are looking to hire an experienced CRO expert / growth strategist to help our clients convert more of their existing web site visitors in to leads and customers. Initially this will be a part-time contract role (~10 hours per week) but there's potential to move to a full-time role for the right person.

Founded by 8x entrepreneur and BigCommerce founder Mitchell Harper, MHD works with dozens of fast-growing brands in Australia and North America. We have a focus on growing their revenue as quickly as possible, via a combination of training and done-for-you marketing services.

Right now we are expanding our team rapidly and looking to help our clients with on-site optimization via a strategic approach to Conversion Rate Optimization.

You can be located anywhere - but you need to be EXCEPTIONAL at CRO. You should live, breathe and obsess over converting traffic to leads and customers.

To be a great fit for this role, you should:

- Seriously be a CRO and growth expert (3+ years hands on experience)
- Know how to optimize any web site to turn more traffic in to leads/customers
- Be familiar with tools like Google Optimize / Optimizely / VWO
- Know which tests can impact conversion rates in the shortest possible time frame
- Be able to walk us through the specific results you've achieved for other clients in a CRO context

Thanks for reading and we're looking forward to hearing from you!

Apply for this position

Please send your LinkedIn profile and answers to the these questions to mitch@mitchellharper.me to be considered for this position:1. Please tell us about a specific CRO / growth experiment you ran and the exact results it created. 2. Which CRO / growth-focused experts/blogs/podcasts do you follow? 3. If you could only test 3 things on a typical web site (to improve visit to lead conversion rate), what would they be and why?

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager


Giant Swarm



* Apply Using LinkedIn








We are looking for a Technical Product Marketing Manager

Your Job


* You are our first hire for our Product Marketing. We know that this is a key role in our products success and we want somebody who takes the lead here. We currently have three Product Owners and one Inbound Marketing Manager who closely works with our CEO. With all of them and the entire team you share and communicate your expertise and get things done.

* Our product is used by large enterprises and we have a lot of experience with why and how we do things and we intend on better communicating that, which will be one of your main responsibilities. Of course, you are not alone, but you’ll be taking the lead here.

* You are responsible for the content of our website, the creation of the product related part of sales materials, ebooks, pitch decks, product slides etc. You don’t have to do the organizational part, but enabling the Sales team and training them on our product, features and competitors should be something you are motivated by.

* Together with the Marketing and Content team, you ensure that our customers are informed about new features through product presentations, documentation, e-books and blog posts.






Requirements


* You have worked in Product Marketing before, technical writing will be a plus. Ideally, you have at least 3 years of work experience in a tech-driven environment (best case scenario, you have a background in enterprise software, cloud, open source and distributed systems). You don’t need to be a coder, but basic knowledge of Linux or a little bit of programming will help you understand what we do.

* You can deal with being empowered to make decisions and you like a high amount of self-organization in teams. We'd be happy if you have gained experience in cross-functional teams.

* You have a good grasp on the ecosystem we operate in and you understand the market, product, business, and any constraints involved.

* You like Research! You observe the trends in the ecosystem. You attend conferences and read relevant publications. You should also test-drive competitors solutions for comparison and input.

* You have excellent Communication skills in English and German. You are happy to transform complex technical stuff into simple and intuitive communications.




Why we think this Job is cool


* Impact, Impact, Impact! We are currently a fully remote organization with 25 people with 13 nationalities (located in 9 countries). Every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.

* You can dive deep into Product Development and Roadmap Creation. You are responsible together with our PO’s how and where new features will be promoted. You are leading here.

* Are you in love with a special topic? No problem. The way we’re organized into SIGs (Special Interest Groups) offer you the freedom to work on things you really love (UX, Security…)

* We serve some of Europe's leading organizations and are talking to many more. We play a key-role in our customers digital transformation. We have partnered up with AWS and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow. This diverse mix will help you to bring life to the broad field of Product Marketing for Giant Swarm.


See more jobs at Giant Swarm

InfoTrust is a Marketing Technology company that helps some of the largest brands in the world build measurement architectures to track what their visitors do online. Why is this important? As they say, “data is the new oil” and digital analytics is one of the critical sources of data that allows organizations to make better decisions about advertising, merchandising, user experience, etc.Read More

InfoTrust is a Marketing Technology company that helps some of the largest brands in the world build measurement architectures to track what their visitors do online. Why is this important? As they say, “data is the new oil” and digital analytics is one of the critical sources of data that allows organizations to make better decisions about advertising, merchandising, user experience, etc.

With two offices (Cincinnati and Dubai), InfoTrust is rapidly growing through its work with some of the largest multinational brands in the world as well as Internet Retailer 1000 companies in North America. Google has recognized InfoTrust with the following certifications – Google Analytics Certified Partner, Google Analytics Premium Reseller and Google Tag Manager Specialist.

InfoTrust is now a four time finalist in Greater Cincinnati’s Best Places to Work (2012, 2013, 2014, 2015). We are also recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing companies in the country.

InfoTrust just moved into an amazing new office with lots of sun and open space, sit/stand desks, ping-pong, and daily catered lunch. Our team of web analytics experts have been continuously recognized among the world analytics elite.

We are currently looking for a technologist who is interested in becoming an expert in analytics and digital marketing. If you’re a person who loves technical challenges, learning how things work, looking over code, debugging javascript, and building scalable systems for some of largest websites in the world this will be an ideal role for you. Not only do we work with cutting edge technology, but we work beyond the cutting edge, with access to technologies that are not available to the general public. We are looking for people for whom being first in the world to play with new technology, even before public beta, and potentially coming up with architectures for huge household brands is exciting. If you are one of those people – contact us.

Job Description

Rocketship -- that is the word that was used to explain what it is like to join InfoTrust at this time. We have done all the prep, we have build this amazing architecture for success (the ship) not we are getting ready to launch? Are you ready to board?

We are currently looking for a DIGITAL ANALYTICS CONSULTANT who is an expert in analytics and digital marketing.

The Digital Analytics Consultant role will be responsible for client management, advanced implementations of Google Analytics, auditing and troubleshooting existing configurations, and reporting analysis to improve clients’ digital marketing initiatives.

You will work closely with web analytics engineer/architect to develop custom tagging and measurement systems.

Responsibilities:

- Identifying client objectives and mapping suitable analytics solutions, ensuring that all required performance data can be reliably tracked and reported
- Advanced Google Tag Manager architecture and setup of complex tracking scripts
- Producing analytics audit reports for corrective or advanced Google Analytics tracking and data collection architecture
- Performing ad-hoc analytics consultancies for clients and documenting the work
– Delivering analytics audit reports to clients and presenting findings in person or via conference calls
- Representing the InfoTrust team in client meetings and presentations, providing technical analytics input
- Assisting in educating clients on the importance of online measurement & providing best practice guidance for technical aspects of analytics
- Providing training to clients ranging from product training for marketing teams to implementation training for technical teams
- Providing consultancy on campaign tagging and providing consultancy on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking
- Providing guidance to data analysts to produce marketing dashboards via Google Drive, Excel and various APIs

Requirements

We are looking for someone the possess our core values and is looking for a place to drive impact, provide superior client support with GA and is looking for learn and grow as an individual and share that knowledge to drive the company towards continued success. The Senior Consultant would be expected to have the following background to be successful:

- Experience working with clients in a consulting role
- Well versed in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager -- from developing client specific implementation plans, to overseeing the implementation and assisting them to identify key ways to improve their marketing initiatives based on the good clean data that InfoTrust will provide.
- Proven experience as a team player -- You enjoy working in a fun and collaborative culture and are willing to take initiative!

We are looking for someone in Cincinnati, Ohio. Ask why Cincinnati might be a great option to relocate to -- we are happy to brag about our city!

We would be willing to consider remote (experienced) workers, just let us know why you are great at working remotely.

Must be authorized to work for any US employer.

items.title: Inbound Marketing Specialist
items.content:
Inbound Marketing Specialist

APAC
Company: Wings4U

FULL-TIME

Overview

Wings4U is a global, 100% remote B2B marketing agency. We’re searching for Inbound Marketing Specialists able to develop strategy and manage inbound campaigns, from launch through successful completion.

Strong candidates will likely be freelancers and consultants working on multiple client campaigns able to join our remote team and take-on projects as they arise. Inbound Specialists should understand customer segmentation, journey mapping, buyer personas, content marketing and have working knowledge of marketing automation software like HubSpot and/or Marketo. Agency experience working with clients in APAC is a must, and international experience a bonus.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure customer success through setting up achievable campaign KPIs and delivering results
  • Identify client’s business objectives, challenges, and key success metrics
  • Develop proposals based on marketing analytics and inbound assessment to address key business and marketing challenges
  • Develop inbound performance reports to analyse and monitor marketing effectiveness
  • Work with marketing and accounts teams to provide continuing assistance with marketing strategies
  • Regularly perform portal audits to identify areas of improvement and quick wins
  • Assist clients in aligning marketing and sales platforms, people and processes
  • Develop campaign plans, deliverables, and resources for your portfolio of B2B technology companies
  • Nurture relationships with retainer clients to ensure ongoing service
  • Continuously innovate service deliver to ensure best results and efficient approach.

Must have skills:

  • Minimum 3 years experience with inbound strategy development and execution, leading multiple inbound marketing campaigns
  • HubSpot inbound marketing certification (or equivalent)
  • Expertise setting up, understanding and interpreting web analytics
  • Ability to convey campaign strategies, educate clients, and nurture relationships
  • In-depth understanding of marketing and sales alignment – smarketing
  • Strong English, verbal and written
